Package com.linecorp.armeria.common.logging

Class LoggingDecoratorBuilder<T extends LoggingDecoratorBuilder<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.common.logging.LoggingDecoratorBuilder<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoggingClientBuilder, LoggingServiceBuilder
    public abstract class LoggingDecoratorBuilder<T extends LoggingDecoratorBuilder<T>>
extends Object
    Builds a new logging decorator.

    • Method Detail

      • requestLogLevel

        public T requestLogLevel​(LogLevel requestLogLevel)
        Sets the LogLevel to use when logging requests. If unset, will use LogLevel.TRACE.

      • requestLogLevel

        protected LogLevel requestLogLevel()
        Returns the LogLevel to use when logging requests.

      • successfulResponseLogLevel

        public T successfulResponseLogLevel​(LogLevel successfulResponseLogLevel)
        Sets the LogLevel to use when logging successful responses (e.g., no unhandled exception). If unset, will use LogLevel.TRACE.

      • successfulResponseLogLevel

        protected LogLevel successfulResponseLogLevel()
        Returns the LogLevel to use when logging successful responses (e.g., no unhandled exception).

      • failureResponseLogLevel

        public T failureResponseLogLevel​(LogLevel failedResponseLogLevel)
        Sets the LogLevel to use when logging failure responses (e.g., failed with an exception). If unset, will use LogLevel.WARN. The request will be logged too if it was not otherwise.

      • failedResponseLogLevel

        protected LogLevel failedResponseLogLevel()
        Returns the LogLevel to use when logging failure responses (e.g., failed with an exception).

      • requestHeadersSanitizer

        public T requestHeadersSanitizer​(Function<? super HttpHeaders,​? extends HttpHeaders> requestHeadersSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize request headers before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive headers, like Cookie, before logging. If unset, will use Function.identity().

      • requestHeadersSanitizer

        protected Function<? super HttpHeaders,​? extends HttpHeaders> requestHeadersSanitizer()
        Returns the Function to use to sanitize request headers before logging.

      • responseHeadersSanitizer

        public T responseHeadersSanitizer​(Function<? super HttpHeaders,​? extends HttpHeaders> responseHeadersSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize response headers before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive headers, like Set-Cookie, before logging. If unset, will use Function.identity().

      • responseHeadersSanitizer

        protected Function<? super HttpHeaders,​? extends HttpHeaders> responseHeadersSanitizer()
        Returns the Function to use to sanitize response headers before logging.

      • headersSanitizer

        public T headersSanitizer​(Function<? super HttpHeaders,​? extends HttpHeaders> headersSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize request and response headers before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive headers, like "Cookie" and "Set-Cookie", before logging. This method is a shortcut of: 
        
 builder.requestHeadersSanitizer(headersSanitizer);
 builder.responseHeadersSanitizer(headersSanitizer);
        See Also:
        requestHeadersSanitizer(Function), responseHeadersSanitizer(Function)

      • requestContentSanitizer

        public T requestContentSanitizer​(Function<Object,​?> requestContentSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize request content before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive content, such as an GPS location query, before logging. If unset, will use Function.identity().

      • requestContentSanitizer

        protected Function<Object,​?> requestContentSanitizer()
        Returns the Function to use to sanitize request content before logging.

      • responseContentSanitizer

        public T responseContentSanitizer​(Function<Object,​?> responseContentSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize response content before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive content, such as an address, before logging. If unset, will use Function.identity().

      • responseContentSanitizer

        protected Function<Object,​?> responseContentSanitizer()
        Returns the Function to use to sanitize response content before logging.

      • contentSanitizer

        public T contentSanitizer​(Function<Object,​?> contentSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize request and response content before logging. It is common to have the Function that removes sensitive content, such as an GPS location query and an address, before logging. If unset, will use Function.identity(). This method is a shortcut of: 
        
 builder.requestContentSanitizer(contentSanitizer);
 builder.responseContentSanitizer(contentSanitizer);
        See Also:
        requestContentSanitizer(Function), responseContentSanitizer(Function)

      • responseCauseSanitizer

        public T responseCauseSanitizer​(Function<? super Throwable,​? extends Throwable> responseCauseSanitizer)
        Sets the Function to use to sanitize a response cause before logging. You can sanitize the stack trace of the exception to remove sensitive information, or prevent from logging the stack trace completely by returning null in the Function. If unset, will use Function.identity().

      • responseCauseSanitizer

        protected Function<? super Throwable,​? extends Throwable> responseCauseSanitizer()
        Returns the Function to use to sanitize response cause before logging.

      • samplingRate

        public T samplingRate​(float samplingRate)
        Sets the rate at which to sample requests to log. Any number between 0.0 and 1.0 will cause a random sample of the requests to be logged. The random sampling is appropriate for low-traffic (ex servers that each receive <100K requests). If unset, all requests will be logged.

      • samplingRate

        protected float samplingRate()
        Returns the rate at which to sample requests to log.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
